definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: Their birthday is on the mother's suffering.
sentences.chinese: 自己的生日就是母亲的受难日。

sentences.english: Many retailers offer online deals for Black Friday.
sentences.chinese: 很多零售商人会在耶稣受难日提供网上交易。

sentences.english: The crude oil market remained closed Friday in observance of the Good Friday holiday.
sentences.chinese: 周五因庆祝耶稣受难日，原油市场休市。

sentences.english: One theory is that Friday is the crucifixion of Jesus, Zhuxiong.
sentences.chinese: 一种说法是，星期五是耶酥受难日，所以主凶。

sentences.english: In Christianity, the rooster is a symbol of Jesus Christ's final days.
sentences.chinese: 基督教中，公鸡让人想到耶稣临终受难日的那几天。

definition: Hanukkah (Chanukah), 8 day Jewish holiday starting on the 25th day of Kislev (can occur from late Nov up to late Dec on Gregorian calendar)/also called 哈努卡節|哈努卡节 and simply 哈努卡
Ghost Festival on 15th day of 7th lunar month when offerings are made to the deceased
to be born/arrival of newborn/birth (of a savior or religious leader)
to suffer a calamity/to suffer (e.g. under torture)/distress
